intro: Pouteria bullata, commonly known as the Brazilian nut tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It is characterized by its large, elliptical leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers that bloom in the summer. The tree produces long, woody pods containing seeds that are commercially harvested as Brazil nuts. Its fruit is an important food source for various wildlife species. The plant is also valued for its ecological role in supporting biodiversity within its native habitat.
